title: Dead code removal patterns v1.6.3.9-v7
details:
Dead code removal in sidebar/quick-tabs-manager.js (v1.6.3.9-v7):

## Removed Code Patterns:
1. Variables prefixed with underscore but never read (_CONNECTION_STATE_DEPRECATED, _lastConnectionStateChange, etc.)
2. Variables assigned but never read (_stateLoadStartTime, _currentInitPhase)
3. No-op stub functions kept for "backwards compatibility" but never called (logPortLifecycle, _transitionConnectionState)
4. Deprecated wrapper functions that delegate to active functions (_sendWithAck â†’ sendToBackground)
5. Broadcast channel handlers that were dead code since BC removal in v1.6.3.8-v6

## Still In Use (DO NOT REMOVE):
- connectionState (used in logging)
- initializationComplete (backwards compat alias, still read)
- pendingAcks (used by handleAcknowledgment and _handleOperationConfirmation)
- handlePortMessage / _routePortMessage (called from _routeInitMessage)
- _sendActionRequest (called in CLOSE_MINIMIZED_TABS and ADOPT_TAB flows)

## Verification Process:
1. grep for function/variable name to find ALL usages
2. Verify if usages are only declarations/assignments or actual reads/calls
3. Check if callers themselves are dead code (cascading removal)
4. Run npm run lint after removal to catch undefined errors
5. Run npm test to verify no functionality broken
